newsitem.title: LIBERIA: Liberia plugs into electronic mail.
newsitem.headline: Liberia plugs into electronic mail.

text.p: Liberia will have access to electronic mail within the next three weeks, the head of Liberia Telecommunications Corp said on Saturday.

The move would help restore the shattered communications network in war-torn Liberia and will assist the organisation of presidential and parliamentary elections due on May 30, managing director Sekou Kromah told Reuters.

His company has signed an agreement with Bannold Communications of Cambridge, England. "The equipment is being shipped through the port of Freetown and we should be finished installing it within three weeks," he said.

Bannold's Liberian representative Patrick Kaikai said: "We are thinking of 500 subscribers during the first few months, after which we will increase the capacity to about 1,100 users. The next step will be connection to the Internet and installation of cellular communications."
